title: Environmental Site Type Vocabulary
description: Controlled vocabulary for types of sites relevant to environmental management and regulation.

terms.label: Industrial Facility
terms.definition: A facility engaged in manufacturing, processing, or industrial operations that may generate environmental impacts.

terms.label: Energy Facility
terms.definition: A facility that generates, transmits, or distributes energy, such as power plants or large renewable installations.

terms.label: Waste Facility
terms.definition: A site used for waste collection, transfer, treatment, recycling, or disposal, including landfills and incinerators.

terms.label: Monitoring Station
terms.definition: A site where environmental measurements are collected, such as air quality or water quality monitoring locations.

terms.label: Remediation Site
terms.definition: A site undergoing environmental cleanup or remediation to address contamination or legacy impacts.

terms.label: Natural Area
terms.definition: A natural or semi-natural area of environmental significance, such as a protected area, park, or reserve, relevant to impact assessments or monitoring.

terms.label: Other Environmental Site
terms.definition: A site type relevant to environmental management that does not fit another, more specific category in this vocabulary.
